Hi all!

I have a directed connectome resulting from Granger causality in a form a matrix and I'd like to visualize it in the from of a graph. I used plot_connectome function, but instead of using lines I ploted arrows.
It looks like this:
![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4404982/30607125-401a9344-9d74-11e7-85cc-948530798c4d.png)
I can send a PR if you like it.
I think that tools which are able to produce directed connectomes are sparse, so it would be great if nilearn support such plotting. In this way or another:)
title: plot_connectome for directed graphs

text: That is exactly what I thought. So, I'll create PR, and then we can discuss details.

I think that it's a feature that would be good to have in nilearn: I suspect it requires actually few additional lines of code.

What's the interface that you have in mind? Maybe adding a "directed=False" argument to "plot_connectome" and the add_graph method of the glass brain object?

Thanks for stepping up!
